review_text: Zachary was a great host. My husband and I were in town for a fundraiser was decided last minute to book an air bnb. We had no problem finding the place and checking in. It was just what we were looking for. Super clean. Had a tv, sitting area and a variety of coffee and chocolates. Bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. The pillows were perfect. If we are ever back in the area we will definitely book with him again. 10/10

name: Paul

Rating, 5 stars
,
·

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Absolutely fabulous stay!
Zachary's place is definitely a 5star+!!
What a great experience for our first Airbnb!
We would highly recommend.
Zachary has excellent communication,
easy to chat with and answered all our questions promptly.
Upon entering neighborhood we felt safe.
Smooth, easy driveway and walk path lined with rocks so no muddy feet... Lower entry had a door overhang which again beneficial since it was raining.
Immediately from opening the door,we were so impressed with the accommodations.
Everything was extremely clean, well placed and truly everything we needed for our short stay . Super comfortable bed and probably the best pillow I've ever put my head on. Slept like a baby.
Property location was ideal for attending our wedding event at South Eden plantation.
Don't hesitate to book this one. You will be very pleased!!
Thank you again Zachary for such a wonderful experience!

She responded to all of my messages right away. The place was beautifully furnished and extremely clean. The patio area was so cute and beautiful at night when you turn on the patio lights that are hanging around the table. We ended up losing power because the storm turned and came up towards Thomasville. We decided to come home a day early and Mindy was very helpful, responsive, and accommodating. We couldn’t have asked for a better experience. If you are planning on visiting Thomasville, I highly recommend this cottage rental! We will definitely be staying again in the future. :)

We hope to be back to visit our family and, of course, stay at the cottage.

Great refrigerator and laundry facilities. Comfortable bed. Amazing lighting and authentic wood floors. Firewood ready to use in the fire pit outside. Although the host’s house was nearby, we had complete privacy. Very safe area surrounded by trees, birds and squirrels. Five minutes to shopping and restaurants. Don’t miss Cherokee Lake nearby. It’s a gorgeous walking trail that is beautifully maintained and worth the drive ( less than ten minutes away). I would love to come back for another visit!

review_text:
Sometimes the expectations of city life cause one to pause when looking into "countryside" airbnb's. Don't be deceived! The Shack is everything an airbnb is supposed to be. Clean and modern...and a piano!?! Urban with that wonderful country indifference too polished showmanship. The Shack celebrates rest and light. It invites you in with spaciousness and thoughtful decorating touches. I was instantly home and when it came time to leave I realized I had not planned enough time to stay.
Don't rush if you stay at the Shack. Plan for 3 nights if you can. Enjoy the restfulness and the clean, white spaces filled with light. You wont be sorry.

The space is clean and beautifully decorated while still feeling like a home. I would highly recommend this place to stay in if you are visiting Thomasville.

February 2022

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Shaunna's place is better than we expected, even after reading all the reviews. Yes the place is super clean and super adorable and comfortable, but here is what really stood out. We have stayed at many AIRB&B and VRBOs for many years. We have noticed that little by little more hosts have gotten chintzy with what they provide i.e. amount of toilet paper, paper towels, bath towels, shampoo, soaps etc. I get it, supplies can get expensive if you have to replace them so often. So we have come not to expect much. We usually always stop by a drugstore and make sure we get water bottles and back up supplies. Well we were shocked to see that Shaunna had already provided those little things that have disappeared. Drinks in the fridge, cute new toothbrushes (that matched the decor :) and mini toothpaste. All the streaming services were logged in and available, we usually have to log into our personal accounts and remember to log out before we leave). Thomasville was fine, but our stay in this cute AirBNB is what we will remember. Thank you Shaunna.

review_text:
We are frequent visitors to Thomasville and usually stay with our daughter and family. This trip was to celebrate a family event and we needed more space and selected Cottage 308.
Our selection was based on the beautifully decorated pictures shown online, and we were not disappointed. It was furnished nicely and had many little extras (e.g , coffee, filters, full kitchen utensils, extra blankets, throws, etc.). There was even a swing on the front porch and we enjoyed sipping our coffee there in the mornings.
Although the cottage is only one bedroom, it lives much larger with many quaint sitting areas.
We highly recommend Cottage 308, especially for couples.
Thomas & Lee Carlisle
Auburn, AL

Otherwise, our stay was wonderful and a great place to land each day after touring the area.

We encounter a water break and Rendall and plumber responded and corrected issue immediately. Some may think this is a bit so good thing to state; however things happen beyond our control and for me it shows the issue being addressed immediately.
Thanks Rendall for a warm and welcome place to call home away from home. Nice walk into town. Great historical scenery and some. This was a last minute booking that was well worth it! We will see you again soon.

review_text: Magnolia House was beautiful as advertised and the location is just perfect for Thomasville. The entry was from the rear with the two reserved parking spots very close to the stairs to the apartment. The back deck was much nicer and more private than we anticipated and was a nice place to unwind with a glass of wine. There are two alleys very close by to give convenient access to the vibrant downtown Thomasville. We would definitely come to Magnolia House again.

name: Jennifer
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

February 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This loft is beautiful! Located in downtown Thomasville above His Daughter boutique. We parked our cars upon arrival and didn’t get back in them until we checked out. We were able to walk everywhere! The loft itself was shockingly quiet for being on Broad St. The original floors were gorgeous and the furnishings were perfect for the space. We also loved there was plenty of seating!
One note for future guests, I would not recommend this loft for those with mobility issues. There was a flight of wood deck stairs to get up to the entrance and the original floors are sometimes uneven. It didn’t bother us - we liked the original features! - but may be troublesome for some. If you want something downtown, walkable, historic and beautiful, This is your place!

She stocked the loft with plenty of towels, toiletries, drinks, snacks, kitchenware, anything you could possibly need was there! The location was fantastic, easy parking, and you could walk to everything downtown. There were plenty of cute restaurants and shops within 1-2 blocks of the loft. I am trying to find a reason to stay here again soon! It truly was an amazing rental experience and I would highly recommend it to anyone!

review_text: Thomasville, GA, was featured in a 6-page spread in the May issue of Southern Living magazine. Since the three of us had never been there before, and it was only a 4-hour drive from our home, we decided to take a road trip for a 3-night stay and explore this charming Southern town. Next, we needed a place to stay … Once The Jerger popped up, we needed to look no farther. Host Diane’s condo is truly magnificent. It is even more wonderful and spacious than the online photos portray. Every attention to detail is carefully thought out: the tasteful furnishings, plentiful amenities, and quality craftsmanship are on display throughout. Everything is immaculate and comfortable and makes you feel right at home. The location can’t be beat, as it’s just around the corner from practically all the shops, restaurants and charming downtown area, all in a very secure spot. We loved it! Diane, too, is a gem and was quick to respond to all our communications. Thank you for sharing your home with us.

The layout of the house would probably be more ideal for couples, but we found everything to be totally adequate and enjoyable! They obviously have pet owners in mind when they advertise the listing as dog friendly, as everything was designed with them in mind- down to a jar of treats for our pups! Would definitely recommend this location.

name: Carrie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Lauren was very responsive. Home was clean and well decorated. She provided bottled water, coffee, and toiletries which were greatly appreciated as we’d already packed everything up for our flight home. The house is spacious. With it being a pet friendly Airbnb, we didn’t get that typical “gross, a dog has been here” feeling that we’ve felt in other places. The home was free of dog hair and normal pet smell. The yard was clean and fenced, wonderful for my sister’s two small pups that were longing for a good run after being cooped in the car for multiple hours. The location is perfect for walking to the beautiful downtown area. The home also had a massive parking area, not normally found in homes in such close proximity to downtown. We will definitely stay here again and recommend to all of our friends needing a place to stay in Thomasville.

The middle bath has a bathtub if you have little ones like us which is awesome. It’s also right across the street from a playground. Loved it!

We felt very safe and are now wishing we had more time to enjoy it more than we did. Lauren was exceptional, going above and beyond - a fabulous hostess! We will absolutely be back, if we (hopefully) find ourselves in the Thomasville area again!

name: Ken
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Nice "high end" historic neighborhood surrounded by schools, ball fields, and playgrounds. Easy trip or longer walk to downtown area. Long sidewalks for dog walks. Neighbors stop to waive and say hello. House is oversized with a nice master bedroom and generous guest room. Lots of closet space. 2 full bathrooms. Nice laundry/utility room with washer/dryer and lots of room for shoes, boots, weather gear, etc. (without having to drag wet, dirty or soggy into the house). Roomy kitchen where 2 can cook and not run into each other. All appliances are made for the space and work great. Huge dining room and dining room table to enjoy meals at. Massive TV in TV room with connected office space and desk. All hardwood floors and white woodwork adds to the classic look. Generous parking in rear of house with fenced in area for a dog. Backyard table and chairs with cushions for enjoying the outdoors and cooler weather (November).

Rating, 5 stars
,
·

,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Oh my word what a home! Fell in love from the moment I drove up to this beautifully restored property. Corner lot with gorgeous outdoor sitting area, oak trees, azaleas and well kept landscaping. Huge kitchen, equipped with all the essentials for our stay. Tastefully decorated with plenty of space for our family and pup. We enjoyed all the card games and local Thomasville magazines Lauren left for us. Office space was used during our stay for my remote work meetings, and couldn’t be happier with how quaint and quiet the neighborhood was. The home is filled with so many lovely windows in every room. Rooms/beds/pillows were super comfortable and sheets were so soft. Lauren did a great job picking out the best linens and towels. Everything was wonderful. Weather was perfect for day trips to Cherokee Park with our Pup, and walks through the historic downtown and streets to admire the Victorian homes. Plenty of shops and restaurants near by. We never drove more than 15 min to reach a destination. Lauren was a reliable host and was always available during our stay and offered plenty of information to help guide us through the villa. We had snacks and water waiting for us when we arrived, which was a nice treat! Overall, the place was a 10/10. I would highly recommend Lauren’s home and can’t wait to come back to Thomasville for another visit with my family!

review_text: This stand alone, garage style apartment was perfect. The bed was very comfortable, the kitchen had everything I needed, and the place was immaculate. The location was excellent. I actually liked how the shower was in a separate space from the rest of the bathroom. This would seem to be especially beneficial for a couple. Moon’s Pizza - what a place! - was just around the corner and all of downtown was easy to get to on foot. The Thomasville History Museum, which I really enjoyed, was a few blocks down the street. Walking past all the beautiful homes to get there was a bonus. Thomasville is such an attractive city with more than enough to keep a person happily engaged for at least a few days. I would love to stay at Wendy and Ron’s place again.

review_text:
We really needed to get away & unwind. Normally we take our Sprinter RV and a boat to a State Park somewhere. I was reading my May Southern Living, and Thomasville spoke to me. But I didn’t want to go “glamping”. Went on Airbnb & VRBO. Found the Dawson St Cottage (converted garage) and it was perfect! Great location, we walked just about everywhere. Spent one cloudy day driving around and heading across the Florida / Georgia line. Although our Aussie went with us except to dinners, he was cozy in his kennel that we brought. However, we noticed a kennel under the bed that we could have used. Wendy thought of everything! Excellent host, cute place, great location!
5 Stars … we’ll be back!

name: Melanie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I stayed three nights in April, and it was just the cozy, relaxing environment I needed. This location is the best of both worlds that I was looking for: a quiet residential neighborhood only a few blocks from the lovely downtown area with lots of locally owned shops, an independent bookstore, bakeries, coffeeshops and restaurants. Super easy and safe to walk (or drive) into the downtown area to get food. If you need a grocery store, a Publix supermarket is just a few miles down the road. Thomasville's "big oak," which is a huge lovely tree that dates back to 1680, is only a few blocks away too. (It sounds corny, but that tree is a thing of beauty.)
This Airbnb was very clean and cozy; the bed was super comfy; it was very quiet (I slept great); the window AC worked well; there was plenty of hot water in the shower; and I felt safe and secure as a woman staying by herself. I would highly recommend this place.

name: Chelsea
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had a wonderful, albeit too short, weekend at the cottage. The space was better than we expected - cleaner, plenty of space for a couple, and the weather was perfect so we even got to sit outside at the little patio table and enjoy it. I saw other reviews about the shower being off the kitchen but it was no trouble for us at all. Actually nice because one could be showering while another could be using the sink/toilet in other space.
We really appreciated all the thoughtful little touches... snacks, drinks, and coffee were provided which was not expected and really really nice. A cute little basket of items that may be needed under the sink in the bathroom (band aids, toiletries, etc). The bed was extremely comfy and we found ourselves wanting to sleep in. One of the main attractions was that it was walking distance from the downtown, where we did a little shopping and had a nice lunch. Cute little town.
We would definitley stay at this cottage again if we come back to town!
